pull.title: rpc: keep `.cookie` file if it was not generated
pull.body: Otherwise, starting bitcoind twice may cause the `.cookie` file generated by the first instance to be deleted by the second instance shutdown (after failing to obtain a lock).

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#28946](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28946) (init: don't delete PID file if it was not generated by willcl-ark)
* [#28167](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28167) (init: Add option for rpccookie permissions (replace 26088) by willcl-ark)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

The bug can be reproduced manually by starting `bitcoind` twice, resulting in a missing `.cookie` file:
```
$ bitcoind -signet &
...
2023-11-03T15:38:09Z Using random cookie authentication.
2023-11-03T15:38:09Z Generated RPC authentication cookie /home/user/.bitcoin/signet/.cookie
...

$ ls ~/.bitcoin/signet/.cookie 
/home/user/.bitcoin/signet/.cookie

$ bitcoind -signet
Error: Cannot obtain a lock on data directory /home/user/.bitcoin/signet. Bitcoin Core is probably already running.

$ ls /home/user/.bitcoin/signet/.cookie 
ls: cannot access '/home/user/.bitcoin/signet/.cookie': No such file or directory

```

rename.from: rpc: keep .cookie if it was not generated
rename.to: rpc: keep `.cookie` file if it was not generated

issue.title: init: Add option for rpccookie permissions (replace 26088)
issue.body:
This PR changes the default authentication cookie permissions on non-Windows OSes to `400`, and picks up #26088 by aureleoules which adds a bitcoind launch option `-rpccookieperms` to set the file permissions of the cookie generated by bitcoin core.

Example usage to make the generated cookie group-readable: `./src/bitcoind -rpccookieperms=440`.

I think this is a pretty helpful (and generally sought-after) change which avoids users having to employ various workarounds.

Perhaps it also warrants a release note?

events.body: utACK, though it might be better to do something like keep the file open and detect if it's the same file/content before we delete it.

Thanks for the review!
Squashed and force-pushed d95dde9441fb791046394ed3784a840a54ef2ab9.
Just wanted to ask whether there are any other outstanding issues? :)

ACK d95dde9441fb791046394ed3784a840a54ef2ab9

Kind of suprised this wasn't noticed earlier, but thanks for the patch!

I also noticed while testing this that the same issue is present with the pid file, but I will open a seperate pull for that in a moment.

issue.title: init: don't delete PID file if it was not generated
issue.body: In a similar vein to #28784, if a second `bitcoind` is started using the same datadir it will fail to start up, but during shutdown remove the PID file from the first `bitcoind` instance.

events.body: Note: If you revert to 7cb9367157eb42ee06bc6fa024522cc14a80138d instead (which is the same), the previous reviews will be valid again

> Note: If you revert to [7cb9367](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/7cb9367157eb42ee06bc6fa024522cc14a80138d) instead (which is the same), the previous reviews will be valid again

Thanks - reverted to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/7cb9367157eb42ee06bc6fa024522cc14a80138d.

issue.title: [GUI] Use `-rpcauth` option for Liana-managed bitcoind instead of cookie path
issue.body:
Following #890 and #898, we can now use the `-rpcauth` option when running the Liana-managed bitcoind and specify the user/password in the bitcoind section of Liana's config file.

This would avoid having to wait for the cookie file to appear when first starting bitcoind and also avoid problems in case the cookie file is deleted while bitcoind is running.

comments.body: @willcl-ark I also prefer to be consistent with the solution chosen for https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28946, so please let me know which fix is preferred.
I think it would be better to stick to using a boolean flag since checking the contents currently is not meaningfully useful or different.
Sounds good, reverted to use a boolean flag.
